id.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.



*See also: [Integration Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/integration.html#configuration-variables)*

sensor.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The ID of the sensor to integrate over time.



*See also: [Integration Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/integration.html#configuration-variables)*

time_unit.docs:
**string**: The time unit to integrate with, one of `ms`, `s`, `min`, `h` or `d`.



*See also: [Integration Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/integration.html#configuration-variables)*

integration_method.docs:
**string**: The integration method to use. One of `trapezoid`, `left` or `right`. Defaults to `trapezoid`.



*See also: [Integration Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/integration.html#configuration-variables)*

restore.docs:
**boolean**: Whether to store the intermediate result on the device so that the value can be restored upon power cycle or reboot. Warning: this option can wear out your flash. Defaults to `false`.



*See also: [Integration Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/integration.html#configuration-variables)*

min_save_interval.docs:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The minimum time span between saving updated values to storage. This is to keep wearout of memory low. Defaults to `0s`.



*See also: [Integration Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/integration.html#configuration-variables)*

reset.docs:
This [Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) allows you to reset the value of the integration sensor to zero. For example this can be used to reset the integration sensor to zero at midnight with a time-based automation.

*See also: [Integration Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/integration.html#sensor-integration-reset-action)*
